after: The SOFIA aircraft is a modified Boeing 747SP widebody (serial number 21441, line number 306; registration N747NA;[11] callsign NASA747[11]) with a distinguished history.

Boeing developed the SP or "Special Performance" version of the 747 for ultra long range flights, modifying the design of the 747-100 by removing sections of the fuselage and heavily modifying others to reduce weight, thus allowing the 747SP to fly higher, faster and farther non-stop than any other 747 model of the time.[15]
